sentences.english: And when it had touched the bones of Eliseus, the man came to life, and stood upon his feet.
sentences.chinese: 那个死人一接触到厄里叟的骨骸，就复活站起来。

sentences.english: Reading newspapers about places where skeletons of murder victims are found would be a good start.
sentences.chinese: 多读报纸，从那些被找到谋杀受害者骨骸的地点着手。

sentences.english: We uncovered a bone of a dinosaur.
sentences.chinese: 我们挖掘到恐龙的骨骸了。
这些骨骸于被发现于2008年。

sentences.english: He thought all the bones at the site were those of dinosaur hatchlings.
sentences.chinese: 他当时以为所有的骨骸都属于恐龙幼仔。

sentences.english: Here a worker returns sifted-out feathers and bones.
sentences.chinese: 图为一名工人在倾倒筛分出的羽毛和骨骸。

sentences.english: One of the animals whose bones archeologists study is the mastodon.
sentences.chinese: 他们研究的动物骨骸之一，就是乳齿象。

definition: person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
to shed skin/to leave one's mortal envelope/remains (of a priest)
